Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

LogoInfo.description: This is used to display logo info, provide a link or inform there is one that can be downloaded from the blockchain itself

oneOf.description: A reference to an externally hosted logo. Must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL.
There is an embedded logo on the chain, make another call to download it.

description.description: A longer description of the token and it's utility. Designed for tooltips or such

logo.description: A link to the logo, or a comment there is an on-chain logo stored

marketing.description: The address (if any) who can update this data structure

project.description: A URL pointing to the project behind this token.

oneOf.description: Transfer is a base message to move tokens to another account without triggering actions
Burn amount specified from total supply permission: executed by dao only
Exits the DAO but removing itself from the ledger QueryMsg::Joined will return None
Send is a base message to transfer tokens to a contract and trigger an action on the receiving contract.
If authorised, mint the `MINT_AMOUNT` defined by the dao to the new wallet permission: minters
Updates the mint cap of the contract.Authorized by the DAO permission: executed by dao only
Updates the mint cap of the contract.Authorized by the DAO permission: executed by dao only
Updates the staking contract address.Authorized by the DAO permission: executed by dao only
If authorized, updates marketing metadata. Setting None/null for any of these will leave it unchanged. Setting Some("") will clear this field on the contract storage permission: executed by dao only

description.description: A longer description of the token and it's utility. Designed for tooltips or such

marketing.description: The address (if any) who can update this data structure

project.description: A URL pointing to the project behind this token.

oneOf.description: If set as the "marketing" role on the contract, upload a new URL, SVG, or PNG for the token

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

EmbeddedLogo.description: This is used to store the logo on the blockchain in an accepted format. Enforce maximum size of 5KB on all variants.

oneOf.description: Store the Logo as an SVG file. The content must conform to the spec at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalable_Vector_Graphics (The contract should do some light-weight sanity-check validation)
Store the Logo as a PNG file. This will likely only support up to 64x64 or so within the 5KB limit.

Logo.description: This is used for uploading logo data, or setting it in InstantiateData

oneOf.description: A reference to an externally hosted logo. Must be a valid HTTP or HTTPS URL.
Logo content stored on the blockchain. Enforce maximum size of 5KB on all variants
Returns the current balance of the given address, 0 if unset. Return type: BalanceResponse.
Returns Some(balance) if address has ever been issued a token, If the current balance is 0, returns Some(0) IF address has never been issued a token, None is returned
Returns metadata on the contract - name, decimals, supply, etc. Return type: TokenInfoResponse.
Returns the current amount of Govec that a wallet will get when claiming
Returns who can mint and the hard cap on maximum tokens after minting. Return type: MintResponse
Returns the staking contract address
Returns the dao contract address
Returns the dao tunnel contract address
Returns the factory contract address
Only with "enumerable" extension Returns all accounts that have balances. Supports pagination. Return type: AllAccountsResponse.
Returns more metadata on the contract to display in the client: - description, logo, project url, etc. Return type: MarketingInfoResponse
Downloads the embedded logo data (if stored on chain). Errors if no logo data is stored for this contract. Return type: DownloadLogoResponse.
Required by `cw-proposal-single` for instantiation if deposit for proposal is required see https://github.com/nymlab/dao-contracts/tree/v1.0.0-vectis/contracts/cw-proposal-single#proposal-deposits

dao.title: Addr
dao.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

download_logo.title: DownloadLogoResponse
download_logo.description: When we download an embedded logo, we get this response type. We expect a SPA to be able to accept this info and display it.
